projections at the sides of the passages very remarkably
developed:- 100 diam.
12. <s>Portion of a</s> Horizontal section through the intermediate
layer of the same disk as Nos 7 and 9, showing an
unusual irregularity in the communications of the
cells:- 100 diam.

            Plate V.
Portions of Disks of Complex Type, shown under
various aspects

1. <s>Ex</s> Small part of a margin of thin fossil disk, showing
an unusual degree of inosculation of the vertical columnar
cells, and <s>the</s> exhibiting the pores opening between
them:- 100 diam.
2. Vertical section of <s>a</s> the central portion of a disk of complex
type; showing <u>four</u> cavities in the nucleus; <s>the simple
[?] of the structure of</s> the first five zones <s>,</s> (<u>a</u>-<u>b</u>) constructed
